result.execSummary:
The defendant Lydia M Hammen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Restitution in the amount of $300.00 has been paid in full.
To be paid to the Clerk of Courts office.  Monies are to be paid during the term of probation.  Court orders the $150.00 cash bond on file be applied to the court costs.

-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.
-No Contact with Chris Wagner except for any family law orders regarding placement or transfer of the children.
-Anger Management Class.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Terminated Regular - 08/02/2019
of Conviction - extends probation for 1 year to 05/23/2020 or until paid in full.

10:03 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Agent Ryan Heluth present in court.  Court questions defendant regarding payment of restitution.  Statement by defendant has $20 in restitution due and other fines. Statement by the Court regarding payment of the court costs.  Statement by the defendant - still have the court costs to pay.  Court finds good cause that the defendant has not made a good faith effort and extends probation for a period of 1 year.  Court informs defendant that if probation is extended again, the Court can fashion conditions to include jail time.  Court goes over right to counsel and how to obtain one.

Court adjourned at 10:06 a.m.
Probation review hearing on May 21, 2019 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
2:55 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Lisa Vanden Branden and Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  ADA recites agreement, defendant will plea to count 2 on 2015CM203, counts 2 & 3 on 2017CM44, count 1 in 2016CM272, count 1 in 2016CM277, count 2 in 2016CM176 and will plea to 2016TR1279, with the balance of the counts being dismissed and read-in.  Atty Privat concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation. 

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged in 2016CM272 and DRI counts 2 & 3; finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged in 2016CM277 and DRI count 2; finds the defendant guilty on count 2 as charged in 2015CM203 and DRI count 1;  finds the defendant guilty on counts 2 & 3 as charged in 2017CM44 and DRI count 1, and finds the defendant guilty on count 2 as charged in 2016CM176 and DRI count 1.  Court finds the defendant guilty on 2016TR1279 and orders 2016TR1278 & 2017TR18 be dismissed outright.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  ADA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by ADA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

2016CM272 (Count 1); 2016CM277 (Count 1); 2015CM203 (Count 2); 2017CM44 (Count 2 & 3); 2016CM176 (Count 2)

(EACH)

SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 2 years.

CONDITIONS:

-AODA assessment
-Court costs.  To be paid to the Clerk of Courts office.  Monies are to be paid during the term of probation.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
-DNA Sample
2015CM203-No Contact with Chris Wagner except for any family law orders regarding placement or transfer of the children.
2015CM203-Restitution of $300 - PAID.
2015CM203-Anger Management Class

2016CM176-No Contact with Jason Anderson.
2016CM176-Restitution of $20.00.

2016CM272-10 days county jail.  Court grants the defendant huber, out of county service and out of county travel.
2016CM272-No Contact with Jason Anderson.

2016TR1279

-$150 forfeiture plus court costs.  Court orders monies be paid during the period of probation.
-Blood Draw Fee - $42.50
-DL revocation - 6 months
-AODA
